thread.title: Promoting tourism to Rajasthan a priority for India
thread.title_full: Promoting tourism to Rajasthan a priority for India

author: eTN Editor
title: Promoting tourism to Rajasthan a priority for India
text:
Promoting tourism to Rajasthan a priority for India Adv: 
By Anil Mathur, eTN India Correspondent | Jul 16, 2015 Adv: 
INDIA (eTN) - The Federation of Hospitality and Tourism Rajasthan (FHTR) has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with the Department of Tourism, government of Rajasthan in India, to promote tourism to the state. 
The MOU was signed in Jaipur by Bhim Singh, President of FHTR, and Anil Chaplot, Director of Tourism for Rajasthan, in the presence of S. Agarwal, Principal Secretary, as well as tourism industry fraternity and federation members. 
Agarwal said that promoting Rajasthan was not only the responsibility of the government but also of the tourism industry. 
Chaplot said that the state should now get more tourists. Bhim Singh said that the federation will be organizing roadshows in partnership with the DOT in the first within the country and the abroad later on.
